arts.ttl: MN: Dream scenario for Modric as Allegri grants full debut in Milan-Cremonese
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller Luka Modric is expected to play from start for AC Milan against Cremonese tonight, thus making his full debut, and it’s a dream scenario in many ways. Reports from earlier this week suggested that Samuele Ricci would get the chance from start in the holding midfield role, following a strong pre-season. arts.ttl: The five key battles that could win or lose the game for Milan against Cremonese
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller AC Milan will start their Serie A season with the game against Cremonese tonight, hoping to make the most of a big crowd. As always, there are some player battles that could decide the outcome. Massimiliano Allegri is preparing to be in the dugout for the first time since his Milan return, competitively speaking anyway. The new Serie A campaign gets underway on Saturday, as the league returns following an incredible finish to last season, and Aaron Rogan has predictions for all 10 games.

Napoli begin their title defence without the injured Romelu Lukaku, who might not return in 2025. They play newly-promoted Sassuolo. Meanwhile, Milan take on Cremonese and Roma face Bologna.

arts.ttl: Gimenez with no intention to exit Milan – Focus on Cremonese fixture
arts.sum: "The only truth is that tomorrow Serie A begins!!! And it will be an incredible season!! Forza Milan!!!" With this post on his X profile, Santiago Gimenez once again declares his loyalty to the Rossoneri colors. Today’s edition of Tuttosport reports that the Mexican will start tonight against Cremonese: the striker has made it clear […]

arts.ttl: AC Milan ready to welcome Cremonese
arts.sum: The Rossoneri return to league action following an eighth-place finish last season, which, for the first time in a decade, meant starting their Coppa Italia Frecciarossa campaign from the first round (a 2-0 victory over Bari). San Siro is set to stage AC Milan v Cremonese on the opening matchday of the Serie A Enilive season.
